newsitem.title: USA: SystemSoft comfortable with Q3 estimates.
newsitem.headline: SystemSoft comfortable with Q3 estimates.

text.p: SystemSoft Corp Monday said it is comfortable with analysts' estimates for the third quarter and the company does not expect profits to affected by a deal between a key customer, AST Research Inc and a rival software company.
"We're comfortable with analysts estimates for the third quarter," said Paul Sereiko, vice president of marketing. "Nothing is wrong. Everything is healthy."
According to First Call, analysts expect the company to report a profit of $0.07 a share, up from $0.04 a year ago.

SystemSoft publishes System Wizzard, a program that automatically diagnoses common problems with personal computers and fixes them. Analysts expect System Wizzard to be SystemSoft's main engine for growth in coming years.
SystemSoft shares fell 14 percent Monday after AST agreed to license a rival diagnostic program from Cybermedia Inc and distributed by Phoneix Technologies Inc.
SystemSoft is scheduled to report financial results on November 26.
